main event: On 28th April 1949 at 1345Z, a military observation was conducted at Fort Bliss, Texas, where a flat silver, shining object was sighted and observed for 3 minutes. The conclusion drawn from the observation was that it was a balloon.
interesting points: The object was described as flat, shining, and resembling the size of a silver dollar.
It was observed at an altitude of 90Â°, and it appeared stationary throughout the 3-minute observation.
The report includes the names and addresses of the military observers who were part of the sighting.
The observation involved the use of a 3 Power Telescope to view the object, which was located approximately 20 miles away from the observers.
The document indicates that there was no physical evidence or trail associated with the sighting.
witnesses: Military personnel including Maj. John R. Henderson, Sgt. Stephen Borowskig, Cpl. Ernest J. Linn, Cpl. Raymond A. Joyner, Pvt. James L. Brown, Pvt. Samuel J. Clarke, and Ed Adcook
